009package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
010
011import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
012
013import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.max;
014import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.min;
015
016
017/**
018 * <p>
019 * Implementation of HSV (hue/saturation/value) color space. See Sec. 13.2.3 of [1] for additional details. All
020 * component values are assumed to be in [0,1]. Note that sRGB values passed to method {@link #fromRGB(float[])}
021 *  * and returned by method {@link #toRGB(float[])} are NOT converted to linear RGB.
022 *  This is a singleton class with no public constructors, use {@link #getInstance()} to obtain the single instance.
023 * </p>
024 * <p>
025 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
026 * (2022).
027 * </p>
028 *
029 * @author WB
030 * @version 2022/09/04
031 */
032@SuppressWarnings("serial")
033public class HsvColorSpace extends ColorSpace {
034        
035        private static final HsvColorSpace instance = new HsvColorSpace();
036        
037        public static HsvColorSpace getInstance() {
038                return instance;
039        }
040        
041        private HsvColorSpace() {
042                super(ColorSpace.TYPE_HSV, 3);
043        }
044
045        @Override
046        public float[] fromRGB(float[] rgb) {
047                final float R = rgb[0], G = rgb[1], B = rgb[2]; // R,G,B in [0,1]               
048                final float cHi = max(R, G, B);                                 // max. component value
049                final float cLo = min(R, G, B);                                 // min. component value
050                final float cRng = cHi - cLo;                               // component range
051                
052                // compute value V
053                float V = cHi;
054                float H = 0;
055                float S = 0;
056                
057                // compute saturation S
058                if (cHi > 0)
059                        S = cRng / cHi;
060
061                // compute hue H
062                if (cRng > 0) { // hue is defined only for color pixels
063                        float rr = (cHi - R) / cRng;
064                        float gg = (cHi - G) / cRng;
065                        float bb = (cHi - B) / cRng;
066                        float hh;
067                        if (R == cHi)                   // R is largest component value
068                                hh = bb - gg;
069                        else if (G == cHi)              // G is largest component value
070                                hh = rr - bb + 2;
071                        else                            // B is largest component value
072                                hh = gg - rr + 4;
073                        if (hh < 0)
074                                hh = hh + 6;
075                        H = hh / 6;
076                }
077                return new float[] {H, S, V};
078        }
079        
080        @Override
081        public float[] toRGB(float[] hsv) {
082                final float H = hsv[0], S = hsv[1], V = hsv[2];  // H,S,V in [0,1]
083                final float hh = (6 * H) % 6;                 
084                final int   c1 = (int) hh;                     
085                final float c2 = hh - c1;
086                final float x = (1 - S) * V;
087                final float y = (1 - (S * c2)) * V;
088                final float z = (1 - (S * (1 - c2))) * V;
089                float r = 0, g = 0, b = 0;
090                switch (c1) {
091                        case 0: r = V; g = z; b = x; break;
092                        case 1: r = y; g = V; b = x; break;
093                        case 2: r = x; g = V; b = z; break;
094                        case 3: r = x; g = y; b = V; break;
095                        case 4: r = z; g = x; b = V; break;
096                        case 5: r = V; g = x; b = y; break;
097                        default: // this should not happen
098                }
099                return new float[] {r, g, b};
100        }
101
102        @Override
103        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] colorvalue) {
104                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
105        }
106
107        @Override
108        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] colorvalue) {
109                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
110        }
111        
112        private static final String[] ComponentNames = {"H", "S", "V"};
113        
114        @Override
115        public String getName (int idx) {
116                return ComponentNames[idx];
117        }
118
119}
